meanings.definition: A small, round fruit with a red or black skin and a single hard seed inside.
meanings.sent1: I love eating cherries in the summer.
meanings.sent2: She picked some fresh cherries from the tree.
meanings.sent3: The cherry on top of the cake made it look even more delicious.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks turned as red as cherries when she blushed.
meanings.sent5: The bowl of cherries on the table looked so tempting.

meanings.definition: The fruit of any of various trees belonging to the genus Prunus, of the rose family, consisting of a pulpy, globular drupe enclosing a one-seeded smooth stone.
meanings.sent1: The cherry tree in our backyard is full of ripe fruit.
meanings.sent2: The market had a variety of cherries for sale.
meanings.sent3: He juggled the cherries in the air and caught them in his mouth.
meanings.sent4: The cherry blossoms painted the town in shades of pink.
meanings.sent5: The cherry orchard stretched as far as the eye could see.
